meanings.definition: A single eyeglass, kept in position by the muscles around the eye.
meanings.sent1: He looked quite distinguished with his monocle.
meanings.sent2: She wore a monocle to read the fine print.
meanings.sent3: The clown's monocle kept slipping down his nose during the performance.
meanings.sent4: Her monocle was like a tiny window into the world.
meanings.sent5: The monocle perched on his nose like a curious bird.

meanings.definition: A lens for correcting defective vision in one eye.
meanings.sent1: Grandpa always carries his monocle to help him see clearly.
meanings.sent2: The optometrist prescribed a monocle for his patient's weak eye.
meanings.sent3: The pirate insisted his monocle helped him spot hidden treasures better.
meanings.sent4: Her monocle was her secret weapon against blurry vision.
meanings.sent5: The monocle transformed his fuzzy world into sharp focus.
